title: 405 O God, Unseen, Yet Ever Near

lines: 1. O God, unseen, yet ever near, Reveal Thy presence now While we in love that hath no fear, Before Thy glory bow.
2. Here may Thy faithful people know The blessings of Thy love, The streams that thro' the desert flow, The manna from above.
3. We come, obedient to Thy Word To feast on heav'nly food, Our meat the body of our Lord Our drink, His precious blood.
4. Thus may we all Thy words obey, For we, O God, are Thine, And go rejoicing on our way, Renewed by strength divine.
